resources.string:
With this app you can download and run AI models on your phone.
 The models do not have internet access, and are completely safe to use.
 On a fast phone you can run models up to 4B in size, on a slower one - 2B.
 Try to use models with Q4 quantization.
 If you run a model that is too large, the application may close.


Currently supported model files:
 .gguf -> with engine LLama.cpp
 .task, .tflite -> only versions for MediaPipe


All rights reserved
 Created by Roman Kryvolapov
 roman.kryvolapov@gmail.com
 Telegram: @RomanKryvolapov

You are a helpful, honest, and concise AI assistant. Answer only the last question. Ignore old questions unless they are related to the last question.
Sorry, it seems something went wrong. Please try again.
Error while receiving data from the server, please try again later
Error during network request, please try again later
Connect to the Internet and try again
Not enough characters in the field.
Refresh the screen if content should be present
User personal identification number not found
The request is being processed, please wait and click update
We could not fetch the necessary information
Notifications from Offline AI Launcher application
In order for application to work properly, you must allow notifications. Current notification: %s
Use Biometric to unlock the app
Too many attempts. Please try again later.
Would you like to enable biometric login?
You can turn on biometrics for faster transactions and in-app actions.
To access some models in the HuggingFace repository, a token is required.\n You can generate a token on the page\n https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens
Prompt is used before the first message in a dialogue with a model.\n\n Write what role the model should be in, how to respond, and other parameters.
Stop generation key worlds, separator is ,
Model name key worlds, separator is ,
Replace key worlds, ORIGINAL=>NEW, separator is ,

Template for first message:
A prompt is required in the first message in the template.

 Template:
A template is used to format the request. Different models have different templates.

 Within a single dialog, all messages are added to the dialog history and sent to the model along with the current message, so after the first message, prompt is no longer needed.

 Stop generation key worlds:
A keyword is required to stop the generation of the models text, these are different for different models. For multiple values separator is ,

 Model name key worlds:
The Model name key worlds parameter is used to determine which model file the corresponding template is used for. For multiple values separator is ,

 Replace key worlds:
You can replace any service messages in the response in the format Original message => Message to replace. For multiple values separator is ,

Maximum number of tokens the model can "remember" at once.\n RAM size affects the context size, recommended values are 2–4 GB RAM - 128 – 256 tokens, 6–8 GB RAM - 256 – 1024 tokens, 12–16 GB RAM - 1024 - 32000 tokens
Maximum number of tokens the model can generate in a single response.
Enables temperature sampling. This adds randomness to token selection. Lower values (e.g., 0.5) make output more deterministic, while higher values (e.g., 1.5) increase creativity and diversity.
Float value for temperature (used if temperature sampling is enabled). Controls randomness. 1.0 = neutral, 0.7 = conservative, 1.3 = creative.
Enables Top-K sampling. Only the top K most probable tokens are kept at each step. All other tokens are removed before sampling.
Integer value for Top-K. Used if use_top_k is true. Specifies how many top tokens are kept.

Enables Top-P sampling, also known as nucleus sampling. Tokens are selected from the smallest possible set whose total probability is greater than or equal to p (for example, 0.9). It provides a balance between diversity and relevance.
Float value for Top-P. Used if use_top_p is true. Represents the cumulative probability threshold (e.g., 0.9).
Enables Min-P filtering. Any token with probability lower than the min_p value will be excluded from sampling. This is a hard probability threshold.
Float value for Min-P. Used if use_min_p is true. Tokens with lower probability are excluded.
Enables typical sampling. This method prefers tokens with a surprisal (unexpectedness) close to the average value. It avoids both too predictable and too rare tokens.
Float value for typical sampling. Used if use_typical is true. Defines how close tokens must be to average entropy.

Enables extended temperature sampling (TempExt). This adjusts the temperature dynamically using additional parameters like delta and exponent. It allows finer control over the probability distribution.
Float temperature value used in TempExt. Similar to temp but for extended variant.
Float value used in TempExt. A delta added to adjust temperature dynamically.
Float exponent value used in TempExt. Controls how sharply probabilities are reshaped.
Enables XTC sampling. This is an experimental method that combines thresholding, temperature, and randomness. Its useful for research and custom sampling strategies.
Float probability threshold for XTC sampling.
Float temperature used in XTC sampling.
Integer seed for randomness in XTC. Helps reproduce results.
Enables Top-N Sigma filtering. This selects tokens whose probabilities are higher than the average plus a number of standard deviations. It filters out statistical outliers.
Float value used in Top-N Sigma. Specifies how many standard deviations above the mean are required to include a token.

Final sampling method used: mirostat_v1 — adaptive entropy sampling with feedback, mirostat_v2 — improved control of entropy, dist — softmax-based probabilistic sampling, greedy — always pick the most probable token.
Integer value. Size of the vocabulary used for Mirostat V1 calculations.
Integer seed for Mirostat V1 random number generator.
Float value. Target entropy (surprisal) for Mirostat V1. Controls how surprising outputs are on average.
Float learning rate (adaptation speed) for Mirostat V1. Controls how quickly the sampler adjusts to reach the target entropy.
Integer. Size of the error buffer in Mirostat V1. Affects stability of adaptation.
Float target entropy for Mirostat V2.
Float adaptation speed for Mirostat V2.
integer value used to make the dist sampler deterministic by controlling the random number generator.
Number of tokens in a batch. This is the size of the input array with tokens that will be processed by the model in one step (batch size by tokens).
Embedding size, usually corresponds to the model input size. For example, for LLaMA 7B it is 4096. 0 = Auto
Maximum number of independent sequences in a batch. Used for multi-sequence generation (batching several queries simultaneously)
Are you sure you want to remove author %1$s from presets list?
Are you sure you want to remove filter %1$s from presets list?
Are you sure you want to remove pipeline %1$s from presets list?
Are you sure you want to remove search %1$s from presets list?
Do you want to close application?
Template: Default, please setup template in settings
Are you sure you want to delete file %1$s?
Are you sure you want to delete dialog?
Are you sure you want to clear chat history?
Are you sure you want to restore default settings? All settings will be erased, downloaded models will not be erased.
Are you sure you want to remove %1$s from presets list?
Preset with name %1$s not found in default preset, contains: %2$s
Are you sure you want to restore default values for preset %1$s?
Please enter model name key worlds
Model not selected, select model first
MediaPipe engine error: model is null
LLama.cpp engine error: model is null
No template found for current model
Start dialog with a model and it will appear in the history
Download the models to start using them or copy them to the application folder
Available RAM threshold less than in MB
Show alarm on available RAM threshold
Unload engine on available RAM threshold
Engine alailable RAM threshold less than in MB
Unload engine on engine alailable RAM threshold
Native memory threshold more than MB
Show alarm on native memory threshold
Unload engine on native memory threshold
Process memory threshold more than MB
Show alarm on process memory threshold
Unload engine on process memory threshold
Show alarm on system memory threshold alarm
Unload engine on memory threshold alarm
Available RAM thresholdr, now available %1$s MB
Native memory thresholdr, now memory is %1$s MB
Process memory thresholdr, now memory is %1$s MB
System memory threshold alarm, is %1$s MB
Voice recognition requires voice permission, allow permission or go to the system settings of the application and allow it there

Backend runs AI models on-device using MediaPipe Tasks with minimal setup. It supports two modes:\n CPU: Slower but works on all devices with lower power usage\n GPU: Faster, ideal for image-heavy models if supported by the device.

Use Max Top-K is a parameter that limits the number of top predictions returned by the model. When enabled, it returns only the top-K results based on confidence scores, improving performance and reducing unnecessary output.

Max Top-K is a parameter that defines the maximum number of top results the model should return. It controls how many of the most confident predictions are included in the output, helping to focus on the most relevant results.
Use Random Seed is a flag that determines whether the model should use a fixed random seed during generation. When enabled, it ensures repeatable results for the same input.
Random Seed is a number used to initialize the random number generator in the model. Setting this value allows the model to produce consistent and reproducible outputs across runs.
Automatically send text to model after voice recognition is complete
The model is in a repository on Hugging Face, which requires authorization to access. Start authorization?
You can not replace default preset
This is an experimental application, it uses new code that has not undergone extensive testing, because of this some functions may not work reliably.
